lines.text: [explaining why he didn't express his unhappiness with the CIA in a more acceptable manner]
It wouldn't have made a difference. I freely chose my response to this absurd world. If given the opportunity, I would have been more vigorous.
They're just as paranoid and dangerous as we are. I don't know why I ever thought any differently.
[to his politically conservative father, while watching the Watergate hearings]
Can't you admit that just once, I was right about something?
[explaining how he met fellow traitor Daulton Lee]
How many guys do you know who's best friend is also their priest?
I know a thing or two about predatory behavior, and what once was a legitimate intelligence agency is now being used on weaker governments.
[Alex, a KGB agent, informs Christopher and Dalton that they are not patriots, but paid traitors]
The moment you accepted money, you became professionals. It's just beginning.
Let me ask you now. These, these clothing. Would this be considered formal clothing for your country? Is this the average garb?
